verses.text: 這事以後，我看見四位天使站在地的四極，掌握著地上的四風，不使風吹在地上、海上和任何樹上。

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 我又看見另外一位天使，從日出之地上來，拿著永活 神的印，向那四位得了權柄可以傷害地和海的天使，大聲呼喊，

words.note: Preceded by a respectful space in the original text.

verses.text: 說：「你們不要傷害地、海和樹木，等我們在 神眾僕人的額上先蓋上了印。」

words.note: Preceded by a respectful space in the original text.

verses.text: 我聽見被蓋印的人的數目，以色列子孫各支派中被蓋印的共有十四萬四千人：
猶大支派中被蓋印的，一萬二千人；流本支派中，一萬二千人；迦得支派中，一萬二千人；
亞設支派中，一萬二千人；拿弗他利支派中，一萬二千人；瑪拿西支派中，一萬二千人；

words.note: One of the twelve tribes of Israel.
One of the twelve tribes of Israel.
One of the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.text: 西緬支派中，一萬二千人；利未支派中，一萬二千人；以薩迦支派中，一萬二千人；

words.note: One of the twelve tribes of Israel.
One of the twelve tribes of Israel.
One of the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.text: 西布倫支派中，一萬二千人；約瑟支派中，一萬二千人；便雅憫支派中，一萬二千人。

words.note: One of the twelve tribes of Israel.
Father of Ephraim and Manasseh, counted as a tribe through his sons.
One of the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.text: 這些事以後，我觀看，見有一大群人，沒有人能數得過來，是從各邦國、各支派、各民族、各方言來的。他們都站在寶座和羊羔面前，身穿白袍，手裡拿著棕樹枝。

words.note: Measure word for people or animals.
In biblical context, often refers to languages.
Indicates origin or completed action.
Refers to Jesus Christ in Revelation.

verses.text: 他們大聲呼喊，說：「願救恩歸給那坐在寶座上我們的 神，也歸給羊羔！」

words.note: Used here as a demonstrative pronoun referring to God.
Postposition indicating location.
Capitalized when referring to the Deity.
Refers to Jesus Christ in Revelation.

verses.text: 所有的天使都站在寶座、眾長老和四個活物的四周。他們在寶座前，面伏在地上敬拜 神，

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'
Used before nouns to mean 'all of' or 'many'
Refers to bowing with face to the ground.
Capitalized to refer to the singular God.

verses.text: 說：「阿們！願頌讚、榮耀、智慧、感謝、尊貴、權能、力量，都歸給我們的 神，直到永永遠遠。阿們！」

words.note: Transliteration of Hebrew/Greek 'Amen'.
Capitalized to refer to the singular God.
A reduplicated idiom emphasizing eternity.
Transliteration of Hebrew/Greek 'Amen'.

verses.text: 長老中有一位問我：「這些身穿白袍的是誰？他們是從哪裡來的呢？」

words.note: Respectful measure word for persons.
Lit. 'body wear', indicating wearing on one's person.
Here, it forms a nominal phrase meaning 'those who are...'
Used to emphasize a circumstance or time.

verses.text: 我對他說：「我主啊，你是知道的。」他告訴我：「這些人是從大患難中出來的。他們用羊羔的血，把自己的衣袍洗潔白了。

words.note: Indicates certainty or emphasis.
Connects a descriptive phrase to a noun.
Introduces a direct object that is acted upon.
Indicates completion of an action or change of state.

verses.text: 因此，他們可以在 神的寶座前，並且日夜在他的聖所裡事奉他。那坐在寶座上的必展開帳幕覆庇他們。

words.note: Capitalized to refer to the singular God.
Functions as 'He who...' or 'The one who...'
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'he who sits'.

verses.text: 他們必不再餓，也不再渴；太陽和一切炎熱必不傷害他們。

words.note: Used with '不' to mean 'no longer'.
Used with '不' to mean 'no longer'.

verses.text: 因為在寶座中間的羊羔必牧養他們，領他們到生命水的泉源那裡。 神也必抹去他們的一切眼淚。」

words.note: A common biblical symbol for Jesus Christ.
Refers to the divine being, often capitalized in this context.
